title: Nineties supermodels Christy Turlington, 50, and Amber Valletta, 45, have a reunion
text:
Advertisement

They were the Gigi Hadid and Kendall Jenner of their day as they grabbed Vogue covers and Versace campaigns in the 1990s.

And on Monday evening 50-year-old Christy Turlington and 45-year-old Amber Valletta had a memorable reunion when at the 2019 InStyle Awards in Los Angeles.

The ladies proved there are still very much head turners as they modeled lovely gowns at the event that also saw Jessica Alba, Olivia Munn and Kaley Cuoco.

Back on: They were the Gigi Hadid and Kendall Jenner of their day as they grabbed Vogue covers and Versace campaigns in the 1990s. And on Monday evening 50-year-old Christy Turlington and 45-year-old Amber Valletta had a memorable reunion when at the 2019 InStyle Awards in Los Angeles

Past perfect: Turlington, left, modeling for Versace in Milan, Italy in December 1991. Valletta, right, walking the Helmut Lang show in 1995 for the fall collection in NYC

Christy, who hails from San Francisco, stood out in an emerald green gown with sparkly accents that came down to the floor and had long sleeves.

The star is now married to actor Edward Burns with whom she has two kids - Finn and Grace.

But 30 years ago she was the hottest thing around as she was the face of Calvin Klein fragrance and also appeared in the George Michael Freedom video with Cindy Crawford.

Green goddess: Christy, who hails from San Francisco, stood out in an emerald green gown with sparkly accents that came down to the floor and had long sleeves

Black magic: Amber wore a stunning low-cut gown that appeared to be made of leather to the party with big gold earrings

Her pals: Here the cover girl is seen with January Jones and designer Domenico Dolce at the splashy event held at The Getty Center

The good ole days: Here Christy and Amber are seen with other supermodels like Linda Evangelista and Stella Tennant in 2014

Her big campaign: Christy seen here with Dutch model Mark Vanderloo for Calvin Klein's Eternity

She was discovered by photographer Dennie Cody while she was riding a horse in Miami, Florida, at age 14.

After graduating from Monte Vista High School in Danville, California she began modeling full time.

Amber wore a stunning low-cut gown that appeared to be made of leather to the party with big gold earrings.

She started modeling in her teens as well and still models to this day. She also broke off to go into acting and has an impressive resume.

Amber was Harrison Ford's mistress in What Lies Beneath. And she has also popped up in Revenge and Blood & Oil.

In attendance: Jessica Alba, Olivia Munn and Kaley Cuoco (from left to right) at the fashion event

Alba, 38, opted for a navy strapless dress cinched at the waist with a narrow black belt.

The actress and businesswoman paired the ankle-length frock with black heels and carried a patterned purse.

The mother of three wore her long honey blonde hair loose and styled in relaxed curls and she added a splash of color with glossy red lipstick.

Classy: Alba, 38, opted for a navy strapless dress cinched at the waist with a narrow black belt

Sleek: The actress and businesswoman paired the ankle-length frock with black heels and carried a patterned purse

Meanwhile, Olivia wore a sparkly midnight blue dress with long sleeves and a thigh-high split.

The 39-year-old added inches with shiny sandal heels and carried a small clutch purse.

Her long black hair was styled back from her forehead and worn loose in curls, and she added dangly earrings and dark red lip color.

Leggy: Munn wore a sparkly midnight blue dress with long sleeves and a thigh-high split and she carried a small clutch purse

Eye-catching: The 39-year-old added inches with shiny sandal heels. Her long hair was styled back from her forehead and she added dangly earrings and dark red lip color

Former Big Bang Theory star Cuoco posed up a storm in a black mini slip dress with a patterned semi sheer full-length overlay.

The overlay, which had three-quarter sleeves, was gathered at the back of the neck with a bow.

The actress, 33, wore her long blonde hair in a sleek ponytail and she stepped out in black pumps with embellished backs.

On trend: Cuoco posed up a storm in a black mini slip dress with patterned sheer full-length overlay. The overlay had three-quarter sleeves and was tied at the back of the neck with a bow

Dramatic: Jones was eye-catching in a sleeveless low-cut black leather dress with asymmetrical hem. She added strappy heels and wore her bobbed hair tucked behind her ears

Suited up: The 47-year-old jazzed up the outfit with a diamond necklace, diamond bracelet and diamond dress rings along with black heels that had silver chain straps

Jennifer Garner went for casually stylish in a black tailored pant suit.

She wore the jacket unbuttoned over a white shirt with the top buttons undone.

The 47-year-old jazzed up the outfit with a diamond necklace, diamond bracelet and diamond dress rings along with black heels that had silver chain straps.

It was a big night for Julia Louis-Dreyfus who was honored at the event with the Icon Award.

The Veep star, 58, looked fabulous in a shiny silver two-piece of sleeveless top and calf-length skirt.

She went for a coordinated look with pointed toe silver heels and silver earrings and wore her shoulder-length hair loose.

Louis-Dreyfus was accompanied by actor Tony Hale, her Veep co-star, who had the pleasure of presenting her with her InStyle Award.

Star power: Julia Louis-Dreyfus, 58, looked fabulous in a shiny silver two-piece of sleeveless top and calf-length skirt. She went for a coordinated look with pointed toe silver heels

Big night: Louis-Dreyfus was accompanied by actor Tony Hale, her Veep co-star, who had the pleasure of presenting her with the Icon Award

Fashion forward: The angular top left one shoulder bare and had a frayed hem. Zendaya's hair was slicked back from her face and she accessorized with pendant earrings

Zendaya, 23, cemented her style credentials with another incredible ensemble of monochrome patterned top and skinny black pants.

The angular top left one shoulder bare and had a frayed hem.

Zendaya's hair was slicked back from her face and she accessorized with pendant earrings.

Her makeup included a smoky eye and glossy pink lip.

Laura Harrier put on a stunning show in a dark green bandeau top and a full-length wrap skirt.

The outfit allowed the 29-year-old actress to flash plenty of skin as she arrived at the awards show.

She had on colorful embellished heels and wore emerald earrings which she showed off by tucking her crimped hair behind her ears.

Gorgeous: Laura Harrier put on a stunning show in a dark green bandeau top and a full-length wrap skirt

Turned heads: The 29-year-old actress flashed plenty of skin in her ensemble. She had on embellished heels, wore emerald earrings and tucked her crimped hair behind her ears

Kirsten Dunst, left, was lovely in a tiered dress while Storm Reid, center, wore a turquoise halter gown with feathered skirt and Natasha Lyonne, right, was a peach in a flowing gown

Quirky: Euphoria star Hunter Schafer, 19, combined a dark red dress with chunky stacked red thigh-high boots and wore her ash blonde hair in a chignon

Christy Turlington, 50, opted for a long-sleeved green gown with high collar and small train.

She was honored with InStyle's Advocate Award for her charity work.

Rachel Bilson, 38, flashed cleavage in a black dress with a plunging neckline.

The bodice was decorated with red and orange flower motifs while the sheer skirt had a tasseled asymmetrical hemline.

Other celebrity guests included Connie Britton, Ellen Pompeo, Sophia Bush, Rachel Zoe, Olivia Palermo, Olivia Culpo and Nina Dobrev.

A very special welcome was reserved for the U.S. Women’s National Soccer Team who came to the event to receive the night's Badass Women Award.

Pretty: Rachel Bilson, 38, flashed cleavage in a black dress with a plunging neckline. The bodice was decorated with flower motifs while the skirt had a tasseled asymmetrical hemline

Laid back: Nina Dobrev, 30, made an entrance in a hot pink silky pajama suit

Posed: Dove Cameron, 23, looked great in a colorful mini dress with her long blonde hair tumbling down around her shoulders

On the guest list: Ellen Pompeo, left, Sophia Bush, second from left, Rachel Zoe, right, and Connie Britton, far right, all came out to support the event

Contrasts: Olivia Culpo, 27, wore a cream pant suit and heels, left. Olivia Palermo, 33, paired a black designer belted jacket with a white skirt and black boots

Group shot: A very special welcome was reserved for the U.S. Women’s National Soccer Team who came to the event to receive the night's Badass Women Award. From l-r: Alex Morgan, Ali Krieger, Ashlyn Harris, Carli Lloyd, and Kelley O'Hara

Honored: Designers Kate and Laura Mulleavy were presented with an award by Kirsten Dunst

Trophy: Fashion Stylist Law Roach was given an award, which was presented by Zendaya

Pals: Makeup artist Vincent Oquendo posed for photos with Janet Mock

Pals: Makeup artist Vincent Oquendo posed for photos with Janet Mock

Gorgeous: Rachel pictured seated inside the awards show in LA

Beautiful: Zendaya wowed in her patterned top with statement earrings

Good times: Ellen Pompeo looked incredible in her mustard number; seen with Kirsten (L), while Zendaya reunited with Storm Reid (R), who plays her on-screen sister Gia in Euphoria

Stage: Jennifer hit the podium during the Monday evening event while rocking a chic look

Cheers! Ellen held an iced beverage in her hand as she spoke at the awards show
